title: Windows XP & 7 Drivers x32/x64 Update 24.09.2013 NASWARI+ZOH
description:
Information about the software:
Release date: 19.11.2013
Title: Windows 7 Ultimate SP1 5in1 IE11 Pre-Activated November 2013 MULTI5
Version: v.7601
Developer: MicroSoft / Generation2
Bit: x86
Language: MULTI5 + Russian LP
Medicine: not required

System requirements:
Processor: 1.5 GHz or higher
Memory: 1 GB of RAM
Hard drive: 16 GB of free disk space
Drive: CD-ROM drive
Display: Monitor with a resolution of 800x600 pixels or higher
Video: 128 MB or more

This assembly is based on the original image of Microsoft Windows 7 Ultimate SP1 x86. Updates have been integrated by November 2013, NET Framework 4.5.1, installed Internet Explorer 11.

The 32-bit version:
Windows 7 SP1 Starter
Windows 7 SP1 Home Basic
Windows 7 SP1 Home Premium
Windows 7 SP1 Professional
Windows 7 SP1 Ultimate

List of Languages:
Danish
Finnish
Norwegian
Dutch (Netherlands)
Swedish

Integrated:
Internet Explorer 11
NET Framework 4.5.1
Updates for Windows on November 2013
Driver Network, SATA and USB3 support

Composition mini WPI:
Adobe Reader
Adobe Flashplayer
Microsoft DirectX 9.0c
Microsoft Security Essentials
Mozilla Firefox
UTorrent

Installation instructions:
Save the image to stick with the program WiNToBootic or DVD with minimum speed.
When prompted key during installation and click Next to skip.

On activation:
At the last stage of the installation window appears WPI
If you want to activate Windows, select Windows Loader and click "Start Installation".
If not, just click on the "Exit".
My advice: make sure you run Windows Loader on this WPI and your Windows will be activated without any problems.

Installing the software:
With WPI-window, you'll be able to install additional software.
Simply select the program you want to install and click on "Start Installation"
If you for some reason missed the installation of WPI, you can run it later, it is located in the image of  sources  $ oem $

Installing the Russian language:
Run the file from the archive windows LP
Wait for the installation
Open the "Regional and Language Options." To do this, click Start, click Control Panel, Clock, Language and Region and the Regional and Language Options.
Click the Keyboards and Languages Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Ã¢â‚¬â€¹tab.
Under Language, select a language from the list and click OK.
Boot your computer
Everything. Your Windows 7 is fully translated!
